EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Steam Power Generation System (Boiler Zone) at (8.0, 20.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Boiler at (8.0, 20.5)  
 • Role: Produces steam fueled by coal  
 • Status: WORKING; Fuel: {'coal': 8}
– Extra Steam Engine at (11.5, 18.5)  
 • Role: Converts steam to electrical energy  
 • Status: NOT_CONNECTED; Energy: 0.0
– Offshore Pump at (1.5, 32.5)  
 • Role: Supplies water to the boiler  
 • Status: WORKING; Connected via a pipe group using 24 pipes

### Iron Ore Mining Operation at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of the following entities:
– Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0)  
 • Function: Extracts iron ore  
 • Status: WORKING; Fuel: {'coal': 7}; Energy produced: 2666.67  
 • Drop position: (-14.5, -48.5)
Note: The belt groups originally linking at (-14.5, -48.5) and (-16.5, -47.5) as well as the wooden chest at (-15.5, -44.5) were removed during recent automated clearance attempts due to obstruction issues. These removals have left the mining operation with only the mining drill remaining on the map.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• WoodenChest Placement – Extended Search Failures and Obstructed Zones  
 – Repeated extended search attempts (with parameters up to max_attempts=100 and step=0.5) failed to secure a free buildable area for WoodenChest. Adjust candidate reference positions further from cluttered zones and inspect the area manually before automated clearance.

• Risky Automated Clearance Operations  
 – Automated clearance procedures have resulted in the removal of essential structure components (e.g. the wooden chest and associated belt groups from the Iron Ore Mining Operation). Verify the importance of nearby entities before removal to prevent accidental deconstruction of established structures.

• Inconsistent Candidate Zone Selection  
 – Multiple candidate positions (such as (-17.5, -43.5), (-5.5, -49.5), (-0.5, -47.5), and (1.5, -47.5)) have repeatedly been identified as obstructed. Refine the obstruction detection and candidate zone selection algorithm to clearly distinguish between non‐critical clutter and key structural components.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────────
get_connection_amount(boiler: Entity, extra_se: Entity, connection_type: Prototype) -> int  
 – Determines the required number of pipes to connect two entities; raises an exception if connectivity or spatial conditions are not met.

place_entity(entity_type: Prototype, position: Position, direction: Direction) -> Entity  
 – Attempts to place an entity of the specified type at the given position and orientation; fails if the tile is occupied or if the necessary item is absent from inventory.

craft_item(item: Prototype, quantity: int) -> int  
 – Initiates crafting for a specified item and quantity; throws an exception if essential sub-ingredients or an operational production/smelting facility is missing.

Important Variables:
• inventory: dict[str, int] — Represents the current inventory.
• boiler: Entity — Refers to the boiler at (8.0, 20.5).
• extra_se: Entity — Denotes the extra steam engine at (11.5, 18.5).
• new_buildable_area: BuildableArea — Utility used to determine available buildable regions.
